meanings.definition: A copy or imitation of a product, especially a cheaper or inferior version.
meanings.sent1: I bought a knockoff watch that looks like the real one.
meanings.sent2: She sells knockoff designer bags at a fraction of the price.
meanings.sent3: The knockoff phone was so bad, it made funny noises when you tried to call someone.
meanings.sent4: The knockoff sunglasses were like shadows of the original, lacking quality and style.
meanings.sent5: The knockoff toy car was a poor imitation, falling apart after just a few minutes of play.

meanings.definition: To make a copy or imitation of a product, especially in a cheaper or inferior way.
meanings.sent1: He tried to knockoff the famous painting but failed miserably.
meanings.sent2: Some companies knockoff popular products to sell them at lower prices.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to knockoff the teacher's experiment as a prank.
meanings.sent4: She managed to knockoff the recipe for the delicious cake after just one try.
meanings.sent5: The artist attempted to knockoff the masterpiece, but it lacked the original's beauty and charm.
